const Vector BLACK

Detailed Description

Implements data structure and operations for 3 floating point variables Intented to use for 3D operations but suitable for RGB-represented color also

void Vector::SampleHemisphereCosNTheta (  float    Ns,
float    specularPdfScaling,
Vector &    outDir,
float &    pdf
)  [inline]
 

find a random direction of a cos^n(Theta) distribution with its modus at the ideal reflection direction *this = idealReflDir

Parameters:
Ns [in] specular exponent of the Brdf function
specularPdfScaling [in] Precalculated Brdf variable, specularPdfScaling = (Ns + 1.0f) / PI2;
outDir [out] The generated new direction, using *this as the idealReflDir
pdf [out] Probability of the selected direction

Definition at line 269 of file Vector.hpp.

References CalculateCoordSystem(), M_PI, RAND, and SetLinearCombination().

Referenced by StIter::GenerateSpecularDirection(). 

00270         {
00271                 Vector X, Y, Z; 
00272                 CalculateCoordSystem (X, Y, Z);
00273                 
00274                 float phi = (float)(2.0f * M_PI * RAND);
00275                 float cos_phi = cosf (phi);
00276                 float sin_phi = sinf (phi);
00277                 float cos_theta = powf (RAND, 1.0f / (Ns + 1));
00278                 float sin_theta = sqrtf (1.0f - cos_theta*cos_theta);
00279 
00280                 outDir.SetLinearCombination(sin_theta * cos_phi, X, sin_theta * sin_phi, Y, cos_theta, Z);
00281                 pdf = powf (cos_theta, Ns) * specularPdfScaling;
00282         }

void Vector::SampleHemisphereCosTheta (  Vector &    outDir,
float &    pdf
)  const [inline]
 

Sample the hemisphere following the cos distribution.

For further information, see McCabe: Markov Chain MC: p. 18 *this = normal vector

Parameters:
outDir [out] The generated new direction, using *this as the normal vector
pdf [out] Probability of the selected direction
